Analyze the way in which secondary sources on history respond to, build on, or challenge one another in terms of research question, argument, scales of analysis, and methodological and analytical frameworks.

Identify and analyze the assumptions and biases undergirding the production of primary and secondary sources. All historical actors and historians write from a particular perspective; an effective historical analysis requires careful consideration of this perspective and the way in which it shapes what and how a particular text or other source is written or imagined.
